intro: Tetracera sarmentosa subsp. andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the Andaman and Nicobar Islands and thrives in tropical rainforest environments. The plant has a slender, woody stem that often grows along the branches of host trees, forming dense clusters. Its small, opposite leaves are elliptical and glossy, while its flowers are clustered in cup-like structures. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by birds, contributing to its ecological role in the forest ecosystem.
